intro: Maytenus versluysii, commonly known as the African mayten, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cornaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by small, fleshy berries. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Maytenus versluysii is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in local medicine.
